revised_title: Observations on Fluid Motion and Resistance: A Historical Review
tldr: This article discusses the challenges in understanding the motion and resistance of fluids, focusing on the theories of D. Bernoulli and M. D'Alembert. It highlights the importance of experimental data in validating theories and determining the time of emptying a vessel through an orifice. The author emphasizes the need for further research to improve our understanding of fluid mechanics.
